meanings.definition: Not wise; lacking wisdom or good judgment.
meanings.sent1: She made an unwiser decision by not studying for the test.
meanings.sent2: It is unwiser to drive without wearing a seatbelt.
meanings.sent3: His unwiser choice to skip breakfast made him regret it later.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the weather forecast was an unwiser move for the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The unwiser choice of taking a shortcut led to getting lost in the woods.

meanings.sent1: Out of the two options, the unwiser choice was to stay up all night.
meanings.sent2: She realized that staying out late was unwiser than going to bed early.
meanings.sent3: The unwiser decision to wear mismatched socks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Comparing prices before buying is never unwiser when shopping.
meanings.sent5: Choosing the unwiser path in the maze led to a dead end.
